alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 5:21PM MST until August 03 at 7:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 715 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. Ponding of water on interstates, highways and in urban areas will create hazardous travel conditions. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 520 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has ended, however flooding remains a concern from earlier rainfall. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Miller Creek, Willow Creek, Racetrack Wash, Butte Creek, Bitter Creek, Coyote Wash, Granite Creek, Winters Wash, Hackberry Wash, Verde River, Munds Draw, Bannon Creek, Yarber Wash, Oak Wash, Agua Fria River, Ash Creek, Blowout Creek, Bottleneck Wash, Little Hackberry Wash, Cherry Creek, Lynx Creek, Little Chino Valley, Coyote Spring and Cienega Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prescott Valley, Prescott, Cherry, Oak Knoll Village, Cottonwood, Jerome, Potato Patch Campground, Playground Group Campground, Mingus Mountain Campground, Powell Springs Campground and Lynx Lake Dam. - This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 284 and 296. State Route 89 between mile markers 310 and 322. State Route 89A between mile markers 318 and 348. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
